summary: This FBI 302 form documents an interview conducted on August 10, 2019, with a BOP nurse/medic regarding the response to Jeffrey Epstein's death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on July 23, 2019. The nurse describes arriving at Epstein's cell, finding him unresponsive with a ligature around his neck, and the subsequent unsuccessful resuscitation efforts.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on the morning of July 23, 2019, with a ligature around his neck. Resuscitation attempts were unsuccessful.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein at MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) with a ligature around his neck. BOP guards were administering CPR when medical staff arrived. Resuscitation efforts, including AED use and epinephrine, were unsuccessful.

events.title: FBI Interview with BOP Nurse
events.description: An FBI investigator interviewed a BOP nurse/medic regarding the response to Epstein's death. The interview took place on the 9th floor outside the 'L' tier at the MCC.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York, United States
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at approximately 0633 hours on July 23, 2019.
A BOP nurse arrived at the cell at 0635 hours and observed guards administering CPR to Epstein, who had no pulse and no signs of life.
Epstein was found with a ligature still around his neck, lying parallel to his bunk bed.
Resuscitation attempts included the use of an Automated External Defibrillator (AED), which advised 'no shock', and administration of oxygen and three rounds of epinephrine.
The FBI interview with the BOP nurse was conducted on August 10, 2019, as part of the investigation into Epstein's death.
